title: Bering Land Bridge National Preserve: Yellow-Billed Loon
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Birds     Yellow-Billed Loon                Yellow-Billed Loon         Photo Credit: Ryan Askren USGS resize  The yellow-billed loon, has very specific requirements for a home. They only nest in northern, low lying tundra where permanent, fish-bearing lakes are nearby. The lakes need to be large and have clear water. These loons dive to retrieve aquatic plants and animals. Not only will they dive for food, but when scared, they choose to dive more often than fly to get away from danger.
